website_summaries.verdict: This award-winning book’s vibrant photos, simple instructions, and both nutritious and appetizing diabetic-centric meals make it the must-have diabetic cookbook.
pros: Over 400 diabetes-friendly recipes for a truly impressive range of great foods
Examples include fried eggs, shrimp skewers, and Italian meatball soup
cons: A little pricy, but it’s a beefy book of recipes

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes! Too many carbs?
customer_reviews.text: Many great looking recipes for diabetics or those who just like good, healthy food. I agree with the reviewer who said many meals appeared to contain too many carbohydrates, so use judgment with how many carbs you actually eat based on your specific medical plan. The idea that 25% of a diabetic meal could be carbs is common, but probably not a good idea for everyone. For those interested in halting the progress of diabetes, I recommend THE END OF DIABETES by Dr. Joel Fuhrman.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Abrahamson

customer_reviews.title: Higher than expected carbohydrate content in recipes
customer_reviews.text: While this book does make some effort to use foods where the carbohydrate might be absorbed more slowly than usual, there are still a number of recipes in here that may not work well for many people with Type 2 Diabetes. Use your glucometer to be sure the foods work for you-- don't rely on the recipes alone to create healthy and safe meals.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W. Bonds

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, quality recipes
customer_reviews.text: The recipes in this book live up to the reputation of ATK. No question. There is a lot of variety and they choose quality ingredients. My only small issue with this book is because of some differences in opinion on how diabetics should eat. If you are on the super low carb side of the argument, you might find that this is too carb heavy (in terms of grains and starchy carbs). If you fall in the moderate carb camp, you will find plenty of options. Many of the recipes could be easily adapted to a lower carb lifestyle. I will use this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: LOL

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend- even for non diabetics
customer_reviews.text: ATK has done a nice job with this book. I’m not diabetic but was looking to reduce sugars and carbs in my regular cooking. The recipes are phenomenal and tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle

customer_reviews.title: Good And Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I am type 2, and I need to pay more attention to what I eat. I decided to start slow and adjust my eating habits, and mine is very bad. It's a good guideline, and I will adjust it to myself, for myself. Very good book.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Not really diabetic friendly
customer_reviews.text: Most of these recipes are 20 to 40g of sugar per serving. A diabetic should not have more than 30 to 50g a day. This cookbook is not a practical diabetic cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Not pratical
customer_reviews.text: More gourmet meals then feeding a family of 4 on a weeknight. This uses a lot of uncommon household ingredients and uses cooking techniques that just aren't feasible for a working family.
customer_reviews.author: Pam V.

customer_reviews.title: Sophisticated and helpful
customer_reviews.text: There are many delicious and sophisticated recipes herein that I think would please just about any palate, but as others have reviewed, you still need to carefully watch the carbs. Diabetics will probably not be well served by potato or rice dishes, which are for some reason included. However, there are enough alternatives that I have plenty to choose from. I appreciate that the recipes aren't overly complex (though not super quick either) and include helpful tips and explanations for why we use certain methods.
customer_reviews.author: Jo E. Meyertons

customer_reviews.title: Not for diabetics!
customer_reviews.text: This book is not for diabetics. Most recipes have really high carbs and sugar!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene W.

customer_reviews.title: Not my best choice. Going to keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: This book has way too many high carb recipes. One had over 50 grams of carbs for one dish. We can not have those. Overall this book is ok, if you are not diabetic.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Too much info per page
customer_reviews.text: Too much info crammed into each page. Font was much to small to read easily especially if you're trying to follow a recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: My most used cookbook
customer_reviews.text: My husband is prediabetic and I was looking for new, creative dishes for him to try. This cookbook has hundreds of recipes and every meal we’ve tried is DELICIOUS. I own several cookbooks from America’s Test Kitchen and each has been outstanding, especially this one. It is my favorite thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda E

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Recipes that (for the most part) Taste Good
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to cook healthier meals. It's my hope that I can control my diabetes with dietary changes and not have to take yet another medication. The authors have really worked hard to create flavorful recipes that are low in fat, salt, and overall calories. So far my efforts have been hit or miss. There are some great options for breakfast here. I enjoyed the Fatoush salad and several chicken dishes, but the mushroom meat loaf was labor-intensive and not that great, especially as leftovers. Still, this is a large book, so there's plenty more for me to try, and I feel sure that I will find some new favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Cariola

customer_reviews.title: A perfect Book for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Not only some great recipes, but useful information on cooking tips and great general information. Especially impressed with the information on cooking grains, especially lentils and quinoa
customer_reviews.author: DAVID L CREDE

customer_reviews.title: A Help Book
customer_reviews.text: Good but some recipes are a bit odd and not likely to have some of the many ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Rory11

customer_reviews.title: The Complete Diabetes Cookbook the healthy way to eat
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook I’ve learned so much about Diabetes and now maybe I’ll be able to control mine better. I’ve been a diabetic since 2005 and couldn’t have a dietitian because my insurance at that time thought it unimportant. I’ve been struggling all that time and now it is effecting my sight. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Melody Holmes

customer_reviews.title: A valuable source for safely cooking for those with diabetes
customer_reviews.text: I always trust the team ATK's work. I gifted a copy to a family dealing with diabetes. The thorough instructions and recipes guide me with knowing what a diabetic person can and cannot have.
customer_reviews.author: corJ

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook for a family
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great cookbook for a family but not when you are cooking for 2. That being said I will still use it an meal plan so I can freeze meals to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie kyelberg

customer_reviews.title: Buy this book!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently got diagnosed as type 2 diabetic and absolutely recommend this book! Some of the recipes are unique but I’m two weeks in and haven’t had a miss yet! They’re delicious and simple to make. My husband isn’t diabetic but loves the recipes! I highly recommend this for any newly diagnosed diabetics who are trying to get their diet on track and learn a new way of eating.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Diabetic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Very well written, excellent recipes. This book has given me the edge on my pre-diabetic diagnosis. I found it easier to transition to healthier eating. I've also been losing weight. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver for a rushed thought for the Dinner Day
customer_reviews.text: Use this on a daily basis with a busy work life, need help at meal time.
customer_reviews.author: Nori Ghi

customer_reviews.title: Great Diabetic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I have love this cookbook. I have very recently been diagnosed as diabetic. I have made several recipies and have liked most of them. There are many color pictures of the recipes so you know what it should look like. My favorite cookbook so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Tasty Recipes
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves this cookbook! The recipes are tasty & easy to make.
customer_reviews.author: Jean E. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: How to massage your Kale for best results.
customer_reviews.text: Love this cookbook. I don't have diabetes but loved the recipes. Lots of beautiful photos and clear instructions. One of the first things I learned was that you have to massage Kale.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki Black

customer_reviews.title: Terrific cookbook!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased over 12 diabetic cookbooks. This book is by far the best. In actuality there is no need to buy any other book.In the book they have helpful hints and ideas that really add to the recipes. I have made many of the recipes and enjoyed all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Cornaggia

customer_reviews.title: Flavorful tecipes
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes of course, they are ATK. Still need to watch the carbs. Finally something besides a plain old boring piece of meat. Makes cooking fun again!!!
customer_reviews.author: O2b5ft

customer_reviews.text: Not sure what this blue stripe is on the book. Seems like it was taped or repaired or something?
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Kittoe

customer_reviews.title: Helpful and healthy.
customer_reviews.text: An extremely good cookbook. The recipes offer a nice variety of meals. I’ve tried a small percentage so far but they’ve been well explained and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Jaueline

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook for Diabetes or weight loss!
customer_reviews.text: Color pictures on almost every page! And every recipe shows the grams of sugar (you'd be surprised how many so-called diabetic cookbooks don't have that!). And they're actually good looking recipes with real ingredients you can actually find in your local grocery store. Lots of tips and notes too! Can't wait to start making recipes from this book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Type 2 Diabetic
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook has given me great recipes to incorporate into healthy eating plan.
customer_reviews.author: illini47

customer_reviews.title: Very informative with great meal ideas
customer_reviews.text: I love this book, lots of good and very specific info with some great recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rose Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Comprehensive
customer_reviews.text: Finally a nice cook book that is easy - non complicated to help with your diabetic diet.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook will be a "go to" book for us.
customer_reviews.author: Piggybank

customer_reviews.title: Clarity of recipes.
customer_reviews.text: Good photos and the recipes are well written. Very diverse menu items.
customer_reviews.author: J.P

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook for anybody!
customer_reviews.text: This cook book is amazing. I bought it for a friend who was recently diagnosed with diabetes. The recipes are so mouth watering I’m going to buy another copy for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Ells

customer_reviews.title: Pregnant w/ gestational diabetes
customer_reviews.text: I have made a few recipes from this book and I felt they were not complicated and the end results were always yummy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rose DeCicco

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes
customer_reviews.text: It is good to know that Diabetics CAN have good food.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie Levar

customer_reviews.title: Diabetic cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I like that it was delivered to the right place... A lot of new recipes
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Ham

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad I saw this book and bought it
customer_reviews.text: Best book I’ve gotten to understand and eat to treat diabetes.
customer_reviews.author: JeanT

product_meta.title: The Complete Diabetes Cookbook: The Healthy Way to Eat the Foods You Love
